website_summaries.verdict: The Elac UF5 are our favorite speakers under $1,000 combining unheard-of transparency with enough kick to tempt rock and dance fans.
pros: The Elac Uni-Fi UF5 sounds twice as good as speakers that cost twice as much
cons: Build quality could be better, bass definition suffers with complex material compared to some other speakers, and they may need an expensive amp to perform their best

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best value in tower speakers available today...
customer_reviews.text: Others have said it best, the sound reproduction from these towers is more than impressive, especially given their price. They won't win any beauty contests, so just close your eyes and listen; you won't be disappointed. I paired these with an RSL Speedwoofer 10S, and powered them an Onkyo TX-8270. This combination work amazingly well together. I listen primarily to vinyl on an Audio Technica LP120BK and streaming music via a Sonos Connect and could not be more happy with the purchase. I picked these up back in early January for $350 each, and would still easily recommend them at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Front Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Great Front speakers. Perfect for TV and Music, as I have it connected to two ELAC Unifi UF5 speakers and one UC5 center speaker, and a Yamaha RX-A860 AV receiver. Connected them with 10ft Monoprice 14AWG copper oxygen free wires that I put Media bridge banana plugs to. Clear sound. A musician commented that it had great top notes, and very full sound. so far no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: gyokuro

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype!
customer_reviews.text: I was highly skeptical. Haven't been in the audiophile sphere for 15 years. Hooked up these speakers to a decent quality A/B analog amplifier rated at 150 watts RMS per channel and after 3 listening sessions - I am a skeptic no more. The speakers are not perfect, but for $700.00 I have never heard this kind of quality. Kudos to Andrew Jones and Elac. I hate hype, but in this instance it is deserved. (These are 4 ohm speakers. They need clean power!!! Do not buy them if you're not willing to invest in a decent amplifier.)
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design, slight finish imperfections.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Just as great as the reviews suggest. Deep bass extension for their size. The dual concentric mid/tweeter arrangement makes for great imaging. The only reason they get 4 instead of 5 stars is slight fit and finish details. A bolt holder in the bottom of one of the speakers was stripped and I had to re-tap it. The paint job is good, but there are very slight imperfections. Still, at $1500 a pair, this speaker is very hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: ChiChelle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speakers
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for few months now, it took upwards of 20 hours for them to really break in and give their best, once that happened it was established they're keepers. Fantastic imaging, superb detail. They will work on cheap receivers but you won't get them to amaze you with it, give them at least 100w each of quality power and they will reward you.
customer_reviews.author: Adam N

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype. These are the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: Simply great. Believe the online reviews on the audiophile sites.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H.

customer_reviews.title: The Hype Is Real
customer_reviews.text: You're looking at these because they're in your price range and/or because they're highly regarded. Don't hesitate. These things are absolutely fantastic. Natural sound simply flows. Airy highs, punchy midst and astounding lows. I had to upgrade my receiver (NAD C 357BEE) to unlock their potential (yes, theres a monumental difference) and they just cook. Don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Hain

customer_reviews.title: Superb Speakers, but Require Power for Best Results
customer_reviews.text: The excellent reviews were spot-on. These are beautiful-sounding speakers for stereo music listening. Be aware that they have a lowish sensitivity, so I would recommend at least 50 watts of power per speaker (more if you like them really loud). If you plan to use them with home theater, they will need a subwoofer for the sound effects (explosions, and the like).
customer_reviews.author: CassaP

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speaker and it’s sound quality surpasses its relatively low price point. Punches above its class. Crisp highs, decent low end punch. Very clear and upbeat without being tiresome to the listener. I have a 90 watt amp into 4 ohms and it’s plenty to drive these babies.
customer_reviews.author: JeffWasHereToo!

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound, great value, solid construction.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive performance across a wide variety of music genres. You need a decent amp to do these justice, I'd aim for one rated at least 100 wpc into 8 ohms. These run at 4 ohms impedance and will tax a lower powered amp. Great upgrade from KEF Q350 bookshelves (which started clipping easily after about 2 years of use). Fantastic value. I've only been running them for a few weeks, so time will tell regarding long-term durability. For reference, my system consists of: •Yamaha A-S801 integrated amplifier •These speakers •Definitive Technologies ProSub 800 powered subwoofer •U-Turn Orbit TT w/Ortofon 2M Blue cart •Pro-ject Tube Box S phono preamp •Onkyo C-7030 CD player
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Eshom

customer_reviews.title: Best value for any speaker on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Speakers in general are relatively simple. A mixture of a few key components with a cabinet. This is where most speakers lead you astray. They package simple functional components in a well designed overpriced cabinet. In return they make high margins. Elac does just the opposite. Andrew Jones focused on designing the components with three way technology - Google it. The cabinets are basic but functional for the sound. The value for these speakers is unmatched. The sound is incredible. They are 4 Ohm so make sure you have a receiver/amp that can do them justice. As a true Audiophile, I highly recommend the Elac -Andrew Jones- UF 5s or the UB 5s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are good sounding speakers. They need a few months to break in. While that is happening, spend time positioning them, angle them, move them in and out to get the best sound stage. Use the elac subwoofer app to auto eq the sub and mess with the other settings and levels. Once you tune these properly they really open up.
customer_reviews.author: cpmanager

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I can hear the music again. The deep tones and sharp contrasting instrumentation in the background. Simply put, I'm ecstatic with these speakers. The Uni-fi UF5 is not just great for the money, they are really superb. Very classy cabinet too. You wont go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Hoffs

customer_reviews.title: USPS would not deliver
customer_reviews.text: Speakers are exactly what I expected and sound phenomenal. Problem is that they were sent by USPS and since they were heavy, USPS would not deliver them to the house. I was forced to load them myself at the Post Office and carry them into the house. Why would vendor even consider USPS when they cannot complete the delivery properly? Ver poor decision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little piece of heaven, with the right amp....
customer_reviews.text: These deliver big sound with the right amp! Imaging and soundstage are excellent. Really hard to beat at this price. I am running a ATI amp rated at 200 watts@8 ohms and 300 watts@ 4 ohms. These things sing! Because of the impedance and efficiency please don't cheap out on the amp and expect magic. Get these!
customer_reviews.author: Killerb

customer_reviews.title: Undeniable Performance and Value
customer_reviews.text: Unreal sound quality, especially for the price. They're 4ohm speakers so before you buy, ensure your receiver is compatible or can power these via a settings adjustment (otherwise, you'll blow your receiver or it will continue to shut down to protect itself). Well worth the investment. Listen in stereo/direct mode for best sounding music. I bought the center channel as well for movie/dialogue, but haven't used it, as the speaker is quite large and doesn't appear to make a noticeable difference in hearing movie dialogue.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Speakers worth twice the price, further discounted on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I read many reviews from many different sources. I think it's fair to say that these $500 speakers compare well with $1,000 speakers. I bought them from Amazon for $332 each. They sound great. For the less-than-audiophile lover of music, this is a good deal. I sprung for these after being delighted with my two ELAC Debut 2.0 B5.2 Bookshelf Speakers, only $100 each.
customer_reviews.author: Busy guy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and small footprint
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers to replace my old DCM Series 12s. They take up much less space and have, in my opinion, a better sound.
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Using for home theater and they sound great.... I recommend at least 125w/channel.
customer_reviews.author: Sam-O

customer_reviews.title: These speakers are amazing! I'm powering mine with a marantz pm-8005
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are amazing! I'm powering mine with a marantz pm-8005. Overall very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 👍
customer_reviews.text: Andrew Jones has done it again,! These speakers are absolutely amazing for the money. They produce an impressive amount of bass without a subwoofer. The mid-range and highs are smooth and realistic! I highly recommend thisbspeaker if you're an audiophile on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Jessy

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Sound is amazing, i am powering them with a Kenwood M2 amp and blown away by the quality of the sound. The only thing i dislike is the pointy feer as they go into the wood floor, pain in the rear to move around. I am looking to replace the feet so they are not pointy to make moving easier.
customer_reviews.author: J. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Speakers are sweet sounding and well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought a refurbished pair on Amazon, paid shipping and import taxes to Singapore. Speakers are sweet sounding and well worth the money..
customer_reviews.author: Sanj

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Best speakers I've had you sound amazing... I've paid a lot more in the past 48 hours that did not sound as good... you do need a lot of power though to drive them otherwise you're missing out
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Elac & Mr Jones A great pair.
customer_reviews.text: A great pair of towers!! They are worth every penny & much more.they came in in perfect condition.They should be paired with a amp with 80 to 100 watts minimum to get the most from them.Im using them as my Home theater front pair & because the base is so full I have no need for a sub woofer!
customer_reviews.author: Joe E.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing speakers for the price... could not be happier with the purchase. They sound like a pair of 3k speaker but for half that. Wonderful towers.
customer_reviews.author: Nate1598

customer_reviews.title: The sound is so clean. I will try to ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is so clean. I will try to update these speakers with more detail but I'm replacing two Paradigm Legends and the sound is much more crisp and clean. The amount of bass is surprising but I was really impressed with the highs. I added the ELAC 400 watt sub to make up for losing two subs in the Legends and the result has been exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: SHANE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After way too much time spent reviewing these speakers, I finally purchased a new Denon receiver to properly power these. Remember they are 4 ohm, and you need an amp that handles them! Break in period was over and I worked these puppies hard...they never distorted, no clipping. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Yahweh

customer_reviews.title: These things sound great! Very happy with the rich sound and even ...
customer_reviews.text: These things sound great! Very happy with the rich sound and even decent bass response for only 5" woofers. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: B. Bartel

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING !!!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC - truly beyond anything I have owned over the years. I replaced a nicer set of Polks I have had for a few years - amazingly accurate clear dynamic sound. Highly recommended - really couldn't be happier - much less for the $$
customer_reviews.author: ZYP11

customer_reviews.title: love love very clean and bright move them around and ...
customer_reviews.text: love love very clean and bright move them around and and good thing happen thank you mr jones,,,
customer_reviews.author: EYECRASH

customer_reviews.title: For the money i really can not recommend them. Actually I prefer the Martin Logan motion ...
customer_reviews.text: I have own many brands and types of speakers. For the money i really can not recommend them. Actually I prefer the Martin Logan motion 12 which at original price was lower than the UF5's. The aluminum cone sounds a bit tinny to me but sound is subjective, just try before you buy(i should have).
customer_reviews.author: Robyn F. Cantwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good speaker, but Amazon sent me a damaged speaker
customer_reviews.author: WANG YU CHEN

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome, took my home theater to another level
customer_reviews.text: Get them, do it now!!! They are awesome, took my home theater to another level!
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great packaging no issues with the speaker they sound great...very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Esco

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of use they so far work well in my large open living room. I'm no audiophile, but they do sound great to me. I would give them a 5 star rating, but I had to send back one of the two speakers I ordered because it was defective. Seemed to have some issue with the tweeter or crossover, because it was dull sounding and not picking up the higher frequencies. Regardless, I was able to send it back and quickly order a replacement that's been working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M. Hay

customer_reviews.title: OK but not great
customer_reviews.text: Did not live up to the reviews I had read. Nice entry level speakers but nothing to write home about. Bought the KEF r900s instead. They are 5x the price so one shouldn't be surprised that those are much better, but don't think you are getting $5k quality speakers as some reviews suggest
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: Tits
customer_reviews.text: Tits compared to anything in the order of magnitude. Little gained for the upper order of magnitude.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: ELAC Uni-fi UF5 Floorstanding Speaker (Black, Single)
product_meta.description: Style:Standard Cabinet, BlackLike a precision instrument, Uni-Fi's flagship floor stander offers advanced technology with its concentric midrange/high-frequency transducer and proprietary aluminum-cone drivers. These support a 3-way, bass-reflex design that delivers a sound unequalled at their price point. Add a subwoofer to create a very serious two-channel system, or use it as the heart of a no-compromise surround set up.Frequency response: 42 to 25,000 Hz
feature_bullets: Custom-designed concentric driver. Frequency response-?42 to 25,000?Hz
High quality base and feet.Sensitivity: 85 dB at 2.83 v/1m

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars106 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
